author: S Sundar
text:
Bodies flown to Madurai by an Army aircraft around 11.30 p.m.

With all Honour:Mortal remains of Lance Havildar Kumar and Sepoy G. Ganesan being brought out of Madurai airport on Monday.— Photo: G. Moorthy

The mortal remains of two Army personnel, who were killed in an avalanche in Siachen on February 3, were brought to Madurai on Monday late night.

The bodies of Lance Havildar S. Kumar (38) and G. Ganesan (25) were flown here by an Army aircraft at around 11.30 p.m.

Minister for Cooperation K. Raju, Madurai Collector Veera Raghava Rao, Superintendent of Police Vijayendra Bidari, senior Army and naval officers and family members of the martyrs received the bodies at the airport.

Mr. Raju led the gathering in paying respects to the soldiers who made the supreme sacrifice, by placing wreaths on the coffins.

After a brief moment, the body of Kumar, who had put in 17 years of service in the 19th Battalion of Madras Regiment, was taken to Theni district.

At Theni GH

An army officer said that the body would be kept at the Government hospital in Theni in the night before it would be handed over to the family members in the morning.

The body of Ganesan was taken to his native place Chokkathevanpatti near Usilampatti.
title: Homage to Siachen martyrs
